Descriptive analysis of co2_footprint per benchmark

Source: vignettes/articles/descriptive-analysis-co2_footprint_per_benchmark.Rmd
descriptive-analysis-co2_footprint_per_benchmark.Rmd

This article shows how to calculate the descriptive analysis of co2_footprint per benchmark using product-level output of Emissions profile indicator.

library(tiltDataAnalysis)
library(tibble)

options(readr.show_col_types = FALSE)

Example subset of product-level output of Emissions profile.

emission_product_example <- example_emission_product_co2_des_analysis()
emission_product_example
#> # A tibble: 8 × 6
#>   benchmark      tilt_subsector unit  isic_4digit co2_footprint ep_product 
#>   <chr>          <chr>          <chr> <chr>               <dbl> <chr>      
#> 1 tilt_subsector chemicals      kg    '5555'                  1 water      
#> 2 tilt_subsector chemicals      kg    '5555'                  4 television 
#> 3 tilt_subsector chemicals      kg    '5555'                  9 tables     
#> 4 tilt_subsector chemicals      kg    '5555'                  8 electricity
#> 5 tilt_subsector chemicals      kg    '5555'                 NA meat       
#> 6 tilt_subsector iron & steel   m3    '6666'                  1 tables     
#> 7 tilt_subsector iron & steel   m3    '6666'                  2 water      
#> 8 tilt_subsector iron & steel   m3    '6666'                  4 tent

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “all”.

co2_all <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "all"
 )
co2_all
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>   co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_produ…¹ co2_median co2_average co2_sd co2_cov
#>     <dbl>   <dbl>                    <int>      <dbl>       <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1       1       9                        6          4        4.14   3.24    78.1
#> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​amount_of_unique_products

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “unit”.

co2_unit <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "unit"
 )
co2_unit
#> # A tibble: 2 × 8
#>   unit  co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_products co2_median co2_average co2_sd
#>   <chr>   <dbl>   <dbl>                     <int>      <dbl>       <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 kg          1       9                         5          6        5.5    3.70
#> 2 m3          1       4                         3          2        2.33   1.53
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: co2_cov <dbl>

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “isic_4digit”.

co2_isic_4digit <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "isic_4digit"
 )
co2_isic_4digit
#> # A tibble: 2 × 8
#>   isic_4digit co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_products co2_median co2_average
#>   <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>                     <int>      <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 '5555'            1       9                         5          6        5.5 
#> 2 '6666'            1       4                         3          2        2.33
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: co2_sd <dbl>, co2_cov <dbl>

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “tilt_subsector”.

co2_tilt_subsector <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "tilt_subsector"
 )
co2_tilt_subsector
#> # A tibble: 2 × 8
#>   tilt_subsector co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_produ…¹ co2_median co2_average
#>   <chr>            <dbl>   <dbl>                    <int>      <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 chemicals            1       9                        5          6        5.5 
#> 2 iron & steel         1       4                        3          2        2.33
#> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​amount_of_unique_products
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: co2_sd <dbl>, co2_cov <dbl>

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “unit_tilt_subsector”.

co2_unit_tilt_subsector <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "unit_tilt_subsector"
 )
co2_unit_tilt_subsector
#> # A tibble: 2 × 9
#>   unit  tilt_subsector co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_products co2_median
#>   <chr> <chr>            <dbl>   <dbl>                     <int>      <dbl>
#> 1 kg    chemicals            1       9                         5          6
#> 2 m3    iron & steel         1       4                         3          2
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: co2_average <dbl>, co2_sd <dbl>, co2_cov <dbl>

Descriptive analysis for benchmark “unit_isic_4digit”.

co2_unit_isic_4digit <- calculate_co2_descriptive_analysis_per_benchmark(
   emission_product_example,
   "unit_isic_4digit"
 )
co2_unit_isic_4digit
#> # A tibble: 2 × 9
#>   unit  isic_4digit co2_min co2_max amount_of_unique_products co2_median
#>   <chr> <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>                     <int>      <dbl>
#> 1 kg    '5555'            1       9                         5          6
#> 2 m3    '6666'            1       4                         3          2
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: co2_average <dbl>, co2_sd <dbl>, co2_cov <dbl>
